title: The Papers: 'Boris and Rishi at war' and 'Partygate report due'
description: The fallout from Boris Johnson's sudden exit from Westminster continues to lead several of the front pages on Tuesday.

title: Number of hay-fever sufferers seeking NHS advice triples
description: The NHS website's hay-fever advice pages received one visit every three seconds on Sunday.

title: Scouts: Millions paid out over UK abuse in last 10 years, say lawyers
description: More than £6m was paid out in compensation payments in the last 10 years, lawyers tell BBC News.

title: Le Mans 24 Hours: Danger, beauty & hydrocarbon - why the race is more important than you realise
description: The 100th anniversary of the first edition of the Le Mans 24 Hour race tapped into the event's glorious past. What it might mean for the next 100 years of motoring is just as profound.

title: US Open: Matt Fitzpatrick and Cameron Smith on PGA Tour-PIF merger plans
description: The proposed merger of the PGA Tour and Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund is "confusing" to players says US Open champion Matt Fitzpatrick, while Cameron Smith thought it was "a joke".

title: Kylian Mbappe: Paris St-Germain are prepared to sell France forward
description: Paris St-Germain are prepared to sell Kylian Mbappe this summer rather than risk losing him for free next summer, after he told the French club he will not renew his contract.

title: Manchester City celebrate historic Treble in pouring rain
description: Watch the best bits from Manchester City's victory parade as the players and fans celebrate winning the Treble in Manchester city centre.

title: PGA Tour, DP World Tour and PIF agreement investigated by US Senate
description: The US Senate says "serious questions" have been raised by the planned commercial merger of the PGA Tour, DP World Tour and Saudi Arabian Public Investment Fund.

title: Children killed at Stoke-on-Trent house named by police
description: Ethan John, 11, and his sister Elizabeth, seven, were found with significant injuries, said police.

title: Manchester City fans and players celebrate historic Treble in the rain
description: Manchester turns blue as Pep Guardiola and his players stage an open-top bus parade.

title: Trump arrives in Florida ahead of court appearance
description: The former president will be formally charged on Tuesday with illegally retaining classified documents.

title: Nottingham Open 2023 results: Britain's Heather Watson beats Jule Niemeier
description: Heather Watson feels "a little bit hard done by" because of the effect not getting ranking points at Wimbledon last year has had on her.

title: Brittany: France shooting suspect under investigation for murder
description: Eleven-year-old Solaine Thornton was shot dead while playing on a swing in her garden on Saturday.

title: The Ukraine offensive: What will win it or lose it?
description: If Ukraine can split Russian troops in the south and hold the ground, its offensive will have been successful.

title: London flooding: Cars push through waterlogged streets
description: The capital has experienced thunderstorms after a weekend of some of the hottest temperatures this year.

title: Everton directors Denise Barrett-Baxendale, Grant Ingles & Graeme Sharp leave board
description: Everton announce chief executive Denise Barrett-Baxendale, chief finance and strategy officer Grant Ingles and non-executive director Graeme Sharp have left their roles.

title: Jack Grealish: Manchester City midfielder stumbles off plane as Treble-winning side land home
description: Manchester City side arrive back in England with Champions League trophy as Jack Grealish stumbles off the plane.

title: Adam Hadwin taken out by security at Canadian Open after Nick Taylor wins PGA Tour title
description: Adam Hadwin is "among the land of the living and in true Canadian form, apologised to the security guard for being tackled", wrote his wife after the Canadian Open incident.

title: Download Festival: Is mental health and TikTok the future of rock?
description: Rock and metal groups predict what the next two decades might look like after Download Festival.

title: Levi Colwill: Chelsea defender trains with senior England side
description: Chelsea defender Levi Colwill has been training with the senior England squad following the withdrawals of Lewis Dunk and Jude Bellingham.

title: Mother jailed for taking abortion pills after legal limit
description: The 44-year-old pleaded guilty to procuring drugs to induce an abortion at 32-34 weeks.

title: Former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi dies at 86
description: The four-time prime minister bounced back from sex scandals and corruption allegations.

title: Groom stopped for speeding on M4 on way to wedding
description: Police say he "had some explaining to do" after being caught driving at 121mph on the M4.

title: Wigan Athletic: HMRC lodges winding-up petition against League One club
description: His Majesty's Revenue & Customs lodges a winding-up petition against Wigan Athletic over unpaid tax bills, with a hearing date of 26 July.

title: Nikki Sanderson says media interest put her in 'constant state of anxiety'
description: Former Coronation Street actress Nikki Sanderson is one of four people suing Mirror Group Newspapers.

title: Flights cancelled as UK thunderstorm warnings in force
description: Storms are forecast for much of the UK on Monday, which could cause floods and travel disruption.

title: Heathrow workers call off first summer strikes
description: More than 2,000 staff said they will postpone industrial action on 24 and 25 June.

title: Nicola Sturgeon remains defiant after dramatic political fall
description: The former first minister insists she has committed no offence after being released without charge.

title: Silvio Berlusconi: How the former Italian PM changed Italy
description: As a media mogul and a populist politician, Silvio Berlusconi had an outsized impact on his country.

title: Yousaf says he will not suspend Sturgeon from SNP
description: Humza Yousaf says he sees "no reason" to suspend his predecessor following her arrest.

title: Woman arrested on suspicion of murder after two children found dead
description: A woman, known to the children, is arrested over their deaths and the stabbing of a man.

title: Silvio Berlusconi: AC Milan pay tribute to 'unforgettable' owner, who has died at 86
description: AC Milan have paid tribute to "unforgettable" former owner Silvio Berlusconi following his death at the age of 86 on Monday.

title: Colin Graves: ECB criticises ex-Yorkshire chairman's racism 'banter' claim
description: Former Yorkshire chairman Colin Graves suggested incidents of racism at the county were "banter".

title: Katie Boulter replaces Emma Raducanu as British number one women's player
description: Katie Boulter replaces Emma Raducanu as the British number one women's player after reaching last week's Surbiton Trophy semi-finals.

title: Women's Ashes 2023: Kate Cross in England Test squad after parasite illness
description: Kate Cross, England's most senior bowler, is named in the Ashes Test squad after multiple rounds of antibiotics to treat a parasite infection.

title: Joni Mitchell makes triumphant return to the stage
description: Supported by a host of famous fans, the star played her first headline show in more than 20 years.

title: Johnson asked me to overrule House of Lords vetting - Sunak
description: The prime minister says his predecessor asked him to nominate people despite a panel rejecting them.

title: England: Joe Marler, Danny Care & Ben Spencer in World Cup warm-up squad

description: President of World Women's Snooker Mandy Fisher says two-year tour cards have helped women close the gap on men.

description: The former Italian prime minister was speaking to the BBC's Sofia Bettiza in 2018.

title: Warning UK mortgage rates set to rise further

title: Silvio Berlusconi obituary: Italy's flamboyant bounce-back politician
description: A media mogul who went into politics, he survived several corruption allegations.

title: Tony Awards 2023: Jodie Comer wins as Ariana DeBose hosts unscripted
description: The Tony Awards, Broadway's biggest night, saw success for several British names on Sunday.

title: Three Britons 'presumed dead' after boat fire - tour operator
description: In a statement, Scuba Travel said the tourists' families had been contacted by the Foreign Office.

title: MPs' misconduct cases need professional HR, say former whips
description: MPs in charge of party discipline aren't equipped to handle misconduct allegations, one senior figure tells the BBC.

title: Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad reacts to famous Ashes moment in 2013 series
description: Stuart Broad reacts to infamous Ashes moment in the 2013 series at Trent Bridge.

title: Floyd Mayweather and John Gotti III exhibition fight ends in mass brawl
description: Floyd Mayweather's exhibition fight with John Gotti III ends in a mass brawl when people storm the ring following a controversial decision.

title: French Open 2023: Is Novak Djokovic ahead of Rafael Nadal & Roger Federer in GOAT race?
description: After Novak Djokovic secures a men's record 23rd Grand Slam, BBC Sport looks at the stats behind the debate about the greatest men's player of all time.

title: Ivan Toney: Brentford striker says missing World Cup worse than eight-month ban over betting
description: Brentford striker Ivan Toney says missing last year's World Cup was a bigger punishment than the eight-month ban he is serving for breaking betting rules.

title: Taylor sinks 72-foot play-off putt to deny Fleetwood in Canada
description: Tommy Fleetwood is denied his first PGA Tour win as Nick Taylor makes a 72-foot putt on the fourth play-off hole to seal the Canadian Open.

title: Brittany: Girl, 11, from British family shot dead in France
description: The girl was reportedly playing on a swing in her garden when a neighbour shot her through a hedge.

title: Hunter Valley: Ten people killed in wedding bus crash in Australia
description: The bus was returning from a wedding in the Hunter Valley wine region when it overturned.

title: Chloe Mitchell: Man, 26, charged with 21-year-old's murder
description: The man will appear in court on Monday, along with another man charged with assisting offenders.

title: Colombia plane crash: Mum told children to leave her and get help
description: The children's mother survived for four days after the plane crashed in the jungle.

title: Calls for Nicola Sturgeon to be suspended from SNP following arrest
description: Some MPs say the ex-leader should be suspended from the party after she was arrested and later released.

title: Birmingham commuter's car stripped of parts twice in two months
description: Charity worker Letisha Brown's Ford Fiesta was "cannibalised" after she parked in Birmingham.

title: The Papers: 'SNP fraud probe' and 'Brits missing in boat blaze'
description: Nicola Sturgeon's arrest amid an SNP finances probe and British divers missing in Egypt lead the papers.

title: The Scottish islands desperately seeking doctors
description: There has been no permanent doctor on the Hebridean islands of Barra and Vatersay since last summer.

title: Kate Forbes says people of faith are fearful of politics
description: Forbes says she does not regret expressing religious views during unsuccessful campaign to be SNP leader.

title: Stepping Through Film: Man trots globe blending scenes into film locations
description: A photographer's "passion project" lining up movie and TV scenes where they were shot sparks a career.

title: Boris Johnson: MPs to conclude Partygate inquiry
description: Mr Johnson quit as an MP dramatically on Friday, branding the Privileges Committee a "kangaroo court".

title: No clear case for routinely granting Albanians asylum - MPs
description: But more needs to be done to support the Albanian victims of people smuggling, a report finds.

title: Belgium's Africa Museum rethinks its relationship with Congo
description: The 125-year-old institution is teaching a new generation of Belgians a different history.

title: ‘Your car will be confiscated’: Iran women defy hijab law despite threats
description: Iran’s police are now threatening to confiscate women’s cars if they are caught without headscarves.
